.

Come enjoy our beautiful oceanfront beach home in the heart of Kill Devil Hills by Avalon Pier. A great home for water lovers, fishers, surfers and families.
This pet-friendly rental has lots of room for multiple activities. Good Vibrations features large open living spaces with unobstructed ocean views from the main living room, kitchen and dining room. On those rare rainy days, you can watch a movie with the family and still enjoy panoramic views of the beach and ocean. An adjoining second living room has an additional futon and space to play a card game or additional seating for meals. An additional futon for extra sleeping space is in the first upstairs bedroom.
The main level master bedroom offers privacy with two second floor bedrooms enjoying direct views of the ocean. The living room has a flat screen HDTV with HD cable. Each bedroom has a flat screen tv with cable. High Speed Wireless internet access is available throughout the house and even on the beach out front. Our home is smoke free. A hose is available on the oceanfront deck to wash your feet.
Check out is 10:00 a.m.
Check in time is 3 p.m.
Rental rates include linens, bath towels and cleaning. No credit card processing fees. Rates do not include taxes (total 12.75% - state and local taxes). A $69 Accidental Property Damage Insurance Policy is also required in lieu of a security deposit. Pet fee $100 if applicable. Travel Insurance is recommended and required, however, tenant may opt out during rental process. No security deposit required. Rates are based on weekly SATURDAY TO SATURDAY rentals. Discount on multiple week rentals.

postings.body:
The Delaware Shores are an easy drive from many areas. Washington DC is two hours away, New York is four hours, Baltimore is two hours, Northern Virginia is three hours, New Jersey is three hours, and many parts of Pennsylvania are only three to four hours away. We are closer than you may have thought.
There are many wonderful locations to consider when vacationing in this 30 mile stretch of beaches including Rehoboth and Dewey Beach, Lewes, Fenwick, and Bethany. We have some of the most beautiful white sand beaches in the mid-Atlantic, where you can soak up the beautiful summer sun. There are long boardwalks, state parks, a resort, beautiful homes, awesome hotels, great stores, and
restaurants ranging from pizza, burgers, candy, ice cream, and salt water taffy, to world class gourmet.
You have the whole house, all on one floor with no stairs. The fully-fenced yard has a fire pit for toasting s`mores, and a wrap-around deck with a picnic table and plenty of seating. Inside you`ll find three bedrooms with four beds and a pull-out couch -- enough room to sleep eight! The driveway in front has space for two cars, no parking permits needed.

 BOOK BEFORE JUNE 15 AND RECEIVE A FREE ONE WEEK CANOE RENTAL A $100.00 VALUE. SO BOOK EARLY.
 Come enjoy all the natural beauty Maine has to offer
 Escape to Little Madawaska Lake Westmanland, Maine and get away from it all. Relax and enjoy the solitude this unique place has to offer people who love the outdoor, and a slower pace of life. Yet you are minutes from dining, shopping and golfing.
 This little corner of heaven and all it`s untouched beauty was created for outdoor enjoyment . Area activities include biking along endless fields of a variety of wild flowers, one of my favorites is lupines that are plentiful along the road leading to your vacation get away. During the summer months you will also enjoy multiple fields of wild flowers and potato blossoms.
 Other activities include fishing in some of Maine`s 6,000 lakes,ponds and rivers. Enjoy swimming during you stay with over 100 ft of lake frontage at your door. Other activities include boating, canoeing, kayaking, hunting, bird watching, area hiking along wooded trails. Enjoy over 1600 miles of ATV trails. You will have endless photo opportunities of Maine wildlife such as whitetail deer, black bear,moose, fox, loons, and hummingbirds are plentiful.
 Some local events just to name a few include the Swedish Colony Midsommer Festival in June, Acadian Festival in late June, Maine Potato Blossom in July,Northern Maine Fair, annual Balloon Festival in late August with balloons from several states and Canada. You can even get a hot air balloon ride.
 Local Mainer`s would say " If you don`t like the weather, wait a minute". In May you can expect anything from 20-70 degrees. In the Summer you can expect 50-80 degrees on an average.
 With your personal comfort in mind, your vacation get away is fully furnished with all the luxuries of home. Amenities include: cooking range, refrigerator,oven, washer/dryer, microwave,coffee maker,toaster,dishes, cookware,utensils, towels, hair dryer,iron and ironing board bedding,TV, DVD player DVD`s, board games, picnic table, BBQ grill,fans, a place for an open fire to make SMORES.

 http://www.littlemadlake.com
 Come enjoy all the natural beauty Maine has to offer
 Escape to Little Madawaska Lake Westmanland, Maine and get away from it all. Relax and enjoy the solitude this unique place has to offer people who love the outdoor, and a slower pace of life. Yet you are minutes from dining, shopping and golfing.
 This little corner of heaven and all it`s untouched beauty was created for outdoor enjoyment . Area activities include biking along endless fields of a variety of wild flowers, one of my favorites is lupines that are plentiful along the road leading to your vacation get away. During the summer months you will also enjoy multiple fields of wild flowers and potato blossoms.
 Other activities include fishing in some of Maine`s 6,000 lakes,ponds and rivers. Enjoy swimming during you stay with over 100 ft of lake frontage at your door. Other activities include boating, canoeing, kayaking, hunting, bird watching, area hiking along wooded trails. Enjoy over 1600 miles of ATV trails. You will have endless photo opportunities of Maine wildlife such as whitetail deer, black bear,moose, fox, loons, and hummingbirds are plentiful.
 Some local events just to name a few include the Swedish Colony Midsommer Festival in June, Acadian Festival in late June, Maine Potato Blossom in July,Northern Maine Fair, annual Balloon Festival in late August with balloons from several states and Canada. You can even get a hot air balloon ride.
 Local Mainer`s would say " If you don`t like the weather, wait a minute". In May you can expect anything from 20-70 degrees. In the Summer you can expect 50-80 degrees on an average.
 With your personal comfort in mind, your vacation get away is fully furnished with all the luxuries of home. Amenities include: cooking range, refrigerator,oven, washer/dryer, microwave,coffee maker,toaster,dishes, cookware,utensils, towels, hair dryer,iron and ironing board bedding,TV, DVD player DVD`s, board games, picnic table, BBQ grill,fans, a place for an open fire to make SMORES.

annotations.source_heading: Lovely Fenway 1 Bed, Avail 8/1. Must See! Photos

postings.heading: Lovely Fenway 1 Bed, Avail 8/1. Must See Photos

postings.body:
So to start off this post I would like to point out once again that this is a SHARED ROOM, as in you will be sharing a room with ME. There are no walls in between our living area and you do not have your OWN room. This may sound unnecessary to point out but for whatever reason people like to overlook the reading aspect of reading posts and miss this point until they come over to check out a room.
If you are still reading this then you are still interested in sharing a room with me and I tried to make a post that I, myself, would have been interested in when I was searching for a place.
I`ll start off with a little bit about me since you will be living with me and it is probably ideal that I sound appealing.
I am a 22 year old student at Berkeley City College (you can still respond if you go to Cal I don`t discriminate) I work at In-n-out Burger in Oakland which is great for you because I am totally down with bringing you home a burger at the end of my shift whenever that is possible. I also have a car, and while I am not a taxi service I am also not against going places for whatever reason we/you may have.
In terms of my hobbies I like to go to the gym and lift some weights so if you are interested in that we can go together if our schedules permit, I also play some computer games (Dota2/LoL/Hearthstone are my games at the moment). I love watching shows when I can (Breaking Bad, Dexter, Parks and Rec, Community, Arrested Development, Archer, Game of Thrones, Its Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Mad Men are some that I have watched/watch). I love listening to music, my favorite genre is EDM, with trance being my favorite. I do go to Raves/concerts/clubs where DJs are playing when I am able to. However I do listen to other types of music (Muse, Arctic Monkeys, Weezer, Incubus, RHCP etc.) and will most likely be going to Coachella this next year. I do enjoy going out and having a great time but I do not come home wasted and ridiculous or anything so don`t be super put off by that. I am usually down to grab drinks/have some drinks and definitely to grab some food.
If this ad is still interesting to you I am sure we would get along pretty well anyway, I feel it is best to be up front from the get go so you get somebody you are actually compatible with, I am looking for a roommate who I can be chill with, not somebody who I dread seeing. With that being said we don`t have to be best friends either, there is a nice middle ground to be had.
Things that may or may not bother you are that I come home late from work sometimes, obviously I will be considerate and as quiet as possible but I will probably shower before bed. Personally I am not a light sleeper so you can come in whenever you want, I grew up in a house with four brothers it would honestly be pretty hard to get seriously on my nerves. I definitely plan on having overnight guests at some point, whether it is friends crashing on a weekend or a friend who is visiting Cal the next morning. I am not saying this will be a regular occurrence but I am positive it will happen at least once and I will tell you ahead of time.
I am a pretty clean and organized person and I would hope you were with our mutual space at the very least. All in all I am a very reasonable person and as long as you are we shouldn`t have any real issues, I do not do passive aggressive ridiculousness and hope you don`t either, if you have a problem tell me and we can talk it out.
So about the room, the room is the top (attic) of a three story (I think previous frat house) due to this the room is very large and positioned very well to work for two people to share. We have our own door that leads to stairs go up to our room so that is nice. The room has its own bathroom with a shower as well as a balcony with an amazing view. Currently the room is already furnished with a bed and desk for your section of the room. There is a very large kitchen at the first floor with three refrigerators and plenty of cabinet space as well as an oven/stove. There is an additional bathroom on the second floor that is open for anyone to use if they would like. We do have on site laundry in the basement and you can store things down there. There is a large lot behind the house for parking your car if you have one for 50$ extra a month, it is extremely convenient given the location and easily worth the money.
The house is located near the corner of Derby and Benvenue and is extremely convenient for anyone who does anything in the general area, whether it be work or school at BCC or Cal. We are located about a mile from either school and there is a bus stop for the 51B right around the corner as well as a food shop and cafe. The house is located basically equidistant to Rockridge/Downtown/Ashby Bart stations so you have your pick. It is also far enough away from everything that there is not a whole lot of traffic of students going through our street but still close enough to be convenient. Without bad traffic I usually get a 12 minute commute to work so this spot could work for you if you worked in Oakland as well.
My roommate will be moving back to France after his internship is over (August 25th) and you would just go under my current lease as a resident of the room.
Rent: 650$ per month
Utilities: 30$ per month for half of the 50mb comcast internet that is already in place.
Deposit: 750$ for half of security deposit, as well as an additional one month rent (650)
The Lease is until November of this year, and I will definitely be renewing it. I have lived here for almost one year and have no complaints.
I am open to you only staying for X amount of months if that is your situation as long as you give me notice and still put down a deposit.
Animals are not okay based on the landlord
I tried to cover every single last detail to avoid people who aren`t legitimately interested, but if you have ANY questions at all feel free to send them my way and I will be sure to answer them to the absolute best of my ability.
Feel free to message me!
